moves.1. e4 g6 2. Bc4 Bg7 3. d3 e5 4. Nc3 Nf6: My attempt to seal the king side has failed!
moves.22... Rdg8 23. Qd2: Further breach of my King side.
Never go grabbing other's pawns, when my own f7 is threatened.
Better 32...,Rhf8 first.
moves.32... Qxd6 33. Rxf7: Start of a very nice combination that I did not spot...
moves.33... Rhf8 34. Rc6 Qe5: Only hope is to get to the back rank...
moves.35. Rxd7+: While the attack looks threatening, there is no immediate checkmate.
moves.35... Kb8 36. b6 Qxb2 37. h3:
This is a white blunder. While h3 solves the immediate checkmate problem for white, this move enables a draw position to become available to black.
Better 37 Rdc7!, which removes blacks checkmate threat and retains pressure on black king.
moves.37... Qa1+ 38. Kh2 Qe5+:
The draw is a reality.
39 g3 is met with ...Rf2
40 Kg1, Qxg3
41 Kh1, Qg2 ++
